content.rendered:
Hey everyone! I talked about Blender in a previous post to my blog (link below), and so I just wanted to showcase something cool you can do with that program: draw and 3D print heads.

Each of these heads took about 12 hours to make, but I did them from scratch instead of importing previous designs. That is part of the reason why there are only two of them: they just take too long to make! You can notice a pretty large improvement from the first design to the second as I got more comfortable using Blender. Still, both heads are supposed to look like me so in that sense I kind of failed. Let me know what you think in the comments below, and make sure to subscribe if you enjoy this content!

https://jorgezhang.com/2018/07/24/creating-cards/

jetpack-related-posts.title: Materials for Designing Games
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: When prototyping games, you can honestly not go wrong with pieces of paper and a pencil. However, I've found that there are a couple of items you can get off of amazon that make the process a lot easier. By using them, the game components will last longer and be…

jetpack-related-posts.title: My Favourite Board Game
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Every game designer has a favourite board game, so I thought I'd talk about mine today! jetpack-related-posts.title: Earn $100/month with Capterra. Can someone explain this to me?
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Ok, yes, clickbait-y title. And something I would normally never post: something reminiscent of a pyramid scheme.
